snippet: Iraqi security forces and their tribal allies reclaimed parts of Ramadi from Qaeda-linked militants, officials said, but the insurgents appeared to maintain control of much of Falluja.
abstract: Iraqi security forces and tribal allies regain parts of important strategic city of Ramadi from Sunni militants aligned with Al Qaeda during bout of heavy fighting; insurgents, however, appear to maintain control of Falluja, despite government efforts to retake city.

byline.original: By YASIR GHAZI and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Yasir Ghazi reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and an employee of The New York Times from Anbar Province.

lead_paragraph: Iraqi security forces and their tribal allies reclaimed parts of Ramadi from Qaeda-linked militants, officials said, but the insurgents appeared to maintain control of much of Falluja.

headline.main: Iraqis Make Gains Against Militants in Key City
headline.print_headline: Iraqis Make Gains Against Militants in Key City

keywords.value: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria
keywords.name: organizations
